page.title: 13Places of Interest
page.content: In 1980 Cauldon Lowe school closed and the building was converted into the Staffordshire Peak Arts Centre. Inside is a gallery and a restaurant. The gallery is full of books, pottery, paintings, jewellery, clothes, toys and furniture which are for sale and are all made in Britain. The restaurant serves home-made vegetarian meals and one of the most popular dishes is homity pie, which is like a quiche containing potatoes, onions and cheese. The Yew Tree. The Yew Tree has won a national "Pub of the Year" competition. Inside are lots of old things like grandfather clocks and pianolas. Outside stands the yew tree after which the pub is named. People come from miles away to visit this public house because of its unique character and very good beer.
